definition[0]: to have a value in money
example[0]: The house must be worth quite a lot of money now.
example[1]: One of the pictures is worth £50,000.
example[2]: Do you know how much the ring is worth?
example[3]: This art collection is worth a fortune (=worth a very large amount of money).
example[4]: It’s a very old machine so I shouldn’t think it’s worth anything.
note[0]: be worth nothing/not be worth anything
definition[1]: to have money or possessions that have value
example[5]: I’ve heard that he’s worth over $2 million.
example[6]: The man who founded the company must be worth a fortune.
